comments:
I was creating a simple JSP page. I wanted to see, if M5 would add imports to my
JSP page. Instead of the Quick Fix behavior I expected I got a
NullPointerException. Here the steps I took.

1. Create new project using Dynamic Web Project wizard.
2. Add a new JSP 
3. Add <@= new Date() %> 
4. Eclipse highlights Date(), because there is no import.
5. Try using Quick Fix by pressing Ctrl+1. 
6 Exception happens.

I've confirmed the error. 
Just so you know, Jeff, we removed quick fix from Java Sections, because to
implement it easily would have required us to use internal packages from JDT,
which we should not have been using. So we removed it. 

But, looks like we forgot to "unconfigure" it, or perhaps there's  apecial way
to configure it if there isn't one?

Also affects the HTML editor's "Surround with New Element", at least at
development time.  In the actual 0.7rc3 build, the linked editing just didn't
match the start and end tag names.

I think it affects a lot of things.  If I try to quick fix an "Unknown tag"
error, I get the same error.  In fact, I have yet to find any error in a JSP
where quick fix succeeded.
Mass transfer from pa to dw. Needs more triage.

The fix for this should be included in the fix for bug 170988.

Note, the NPE should be fixed, but there are still no quick fixes for Java in JSPs.  If you are still interested in this, please open a new enhancement request if one has not already been opened for it.
